result.execSummary:
The defendant James W Schmit was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant James W Schmit in court with attorney Gary Stephen Dodge.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 16CF139 and 16CM138 @ 10:30 a.m. Agreement stated - 16CF139 Def will plead to ct 1, ct 2 dri. 16CM138 Def will plead to ct 1, ct 2 dri. 16CF139 ct 1 - withheld sentence, 2 yrs probation, costs, DNA surcharge, AODA and follow through, maintain absolute sobriety, no illegal use or possession of controlled substances, take prescriptions only as prescribed, no contact with Lakeside Pharmacy, counseling deemed necessary. 16CM138 ct 1 - withheld sentence, 1 yr probation, concurrent, costs, DNA surcharge, same conditions as 16CF139, restitution $347.17 to Lakeside Pharmacy. State has complied with VWNR. Atty Dodge agrees. Def understands and agrees. Plea quest. reviewed. 16CF139 ct 1 - no contest plea. 16CM138 ct 1 - no contest plea. Court grants motion to dismiss and read in 16CF139 ct 2 and 16CM138 ct 2. Constitutional rights, elements reviewed. Def admits prior convictions. Possible penalties reviewed. Atty Dodge satisfied. Court finds Def understands and pleas freely & voluntarily given. Factual basis. Court accepts pleas and finds Def guilty of 16CF139 ct 1 and 16CM138 ct 1. Sentencing remarks by counsel. Statement by Defendant. Remarks by the Court. Will follow agreement. 16CF139 ct 1 - sentence withheld, 2 yrs probation, court costs, DNA surcharge and sample if not already on file, AODA and follow through at discretion of agent, maintain absolute sobriety, no illegal use or possession of controlled substances, no contact w/Lakeside Pharmacy & Grocery, counseling deemed necessary. No credit if revoked. 16CM138 ct 1 - sentence withheld, 1 yr probation, court costs, DNA surcharge, same conditions as 16CF139, restitution $347.17, no credit if revoked. Def advised of firearms and voting restrictions. 
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Postconviction rights.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 28, 2018 at 10:30 am.
